alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 6:44PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Yuma and north central Kit Carson Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 644 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cope, or 24 miles north of Seibert, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Yuma and north central Kit Carson Counties, including the following locations... Joes and Kirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
